Half-Life 2: Episode One (2006)

Pequeña continuación en formato episódico de lo visto en Half-Life 2, esta vez centrado en Alyx, de la cual no te separas en todo el episodio, es cortito y muy conservador pero al César lo que es del César, sigue siendo un trabajo muy bien hecho.

I do reomend this game, its is still great and the sound desigin is still amazing, but its so short, Half life took me 15-17 hours to beat on the first go, half life 2 took me 13-15 hours to beat, this one took me 3-4 hours, i am a it disapointed but non the less it is a good game but dont have the highest of hopes

Спустя почти 1.5 года, после выхода оригинальной HL2, выходит первый эпизод, что несомненно прекрасно. Продолжения сюжета, развитие идей, сюжетных и технологических, в плане игрового движка. Прекрасная шутерная механика и по сей день, простенькие загадки для мышления, красивый визуал, хотя время даёт о себе знать.

А теперь о плохом. :) По прежнему отвратительная русская локализация! Играть советую исключительно на английском дубляже. По прежнему тупейший ИИ союзников, забыл этот явный косяк отметить в обзоре на HL2, исправляюсь. И последнее не то что минус, но дико малая продолжительность эпизода, понимаю что это дополнение так сказать к основной игре, но этот эпизод дико короткий по сравнению даже со вторым.

Брать само собой рекомендую! Играется очень бодро и по сей день, фанатам серии однозначно к покупке! :) Да и просто любителям шутеров :)

Разработчики передумали убивать Аликс и активировали пурпурных вортигонтов, спасших боевую подругу Фримена и доставших самого Фримена из лап зловредного межгалактического чинуши по прозвищу Джи-Мен. В дело тут же вступает загадка от ядра Цитадели: на стабилизацию даётся 30 минут. Выиграв время и прихватив с собой инопланетную флешку с очень секретными файлами, герои, как и все нормальные россияне, отправляются за город. А теперь давайте разберёмся, что порадовало игроков, а за чем Valve недоглядели.

Плюсы:
Гордому одиночеству Гордона пришёл конец: Аликс стала играть важную роль в сюжете. Она пытается шутить, активно подкатывает и меньше застревает в дверях.
Уровни пополнились тяжёлыми предметами: орудовать грави-пушкой стало легче, а за отказ от огнестрела вам дадут ачивку.
В наличии пара новых механик: приготовьтесь поджигать фальшфейерами несчастных зомби и затыкать машинами гнёзда муравьиных львов.
В целом графика идентична Half-Life 2, но есть и небольшие отличия в виде допиленного освещения и подправленной лицевой анимации. Оранжевые тона подчёркивают нездоровую ситуацию в Сити 17.
Звук работает на погружение — мы ещё никогда не слышали, чтобы голос Патруля несла бессвязный бред. Саундтрек тоже хорош: Келли Бэйли мастерски передал атмосферу трещащего по швам города с помощью индустриального скрежета и внеземного эмбиента.

Минусы:
Игра длится всего 4 часа. Эти часы запомнятся вам надолго, но смысл эпизодической модели состоит только в том, чтобы поднять бабла.
Сеттинг мало отличается от последних глав Half-Life 2. В добавлении нового контента разработчики ограничились зомбайном — омертвелым аналогом обезьяны с гранатой.

15년이 지난 지금 플레이해도 여전히 세련된 게임. 그래픽, 스토리, 연출, 조작, 사운드, 전투, AI, 레벨 디자인 등 모든 면에서 시대를 앞선 하나의 명작. 나이가 들면서 짧게 엔딩을 볼 수 있는 걸 선호하게 됐는데, 오랜만에 '짧은 플레이 타임'이 아쉽게 느껴진 게임. 요새에서 17번 지구의 열차까지, 그 모든 순간이 하나도 지루하지 않고 흥미진진한 모험의 연속이었던 게임. 

하프라이프를 하지 않았던 나의 게이머로서의 인생은 반쪽짜리 인생이었다.

The first in the supposed 'trilogy' of Half-Life 2 episodes is Half-Life 2 Episode One, a decent addition to an already great story. Set right after the ambiguous ending of the incredible Half-Life 2, this "episodic feature" is merely the length of a sizeable slice from the main game. Not exactly short, but hardly long, this game serves as an enjoyable extension of the Half-Life 2 story, while also whetting our appetites for the next (and hands-down, superior) episode. I find it worthy of mention that this game was released nearly a whole two years after its predecessor, in June of 2006.
As far as game-play goes, this is simply more of the game we know and love. I applaud the developers for starting the game with the interesting gimmick of having ONLY the gravity gun as your weapon. Without even a crowbar at your side, you rely entirely on the great and satisfying physics of the Source engine to clear the path through your enemies. As much as I do love the execution of this idea, I still think it's a little annoying to have to wait until the third chapter before you are equipped with a pistol and shotgun. This is, after all, a first-person-shooter game. 
While Half-Life 2 boasted fourteen whopping chapters, Episode One has only five. But that's why it's called an EPISODE. I also must express my displeasure with the blandness of the Urban Flight chapter, which almost feels like a clone of Anticitizen One or 'Follow Freeman!' from the last game. Still, the chapter does include some nice set-pieces, cool challenges and an epic shootout in a hospital. 
Not that you may notice, but the Source engine looks ever so slightly better than it did in 2004, and it's good to see a real expansion utilising new animations, more detailed facial expressions and of course the high dynamic range first showcased in the Lost Coast bonus chapter from 2005. Alyx, who now accompanies the player for practically the entire episode, has been tweaked up a little so that her A.I is a little more dynamic and she seems a bit more realistic. Also, (thank God) she no longer charges ahead into the fray and actually lets you, the player, decide the pace of the game. I will say up front that if you were not a fan of Alyx Vance in Half-Life 2, then avoid this game at all costs. I can't imagine why, however. She is literally designed to be an enjoyable companion, and I'd say Valve really outdid themselves in this regard. 
I find that this game is often overshadowed by its counterpart Episode Two, and for good reason. Nevertheless, what we have here is a game that - despite some sticky pacing at the start and a slight bit of repetition throughout - is perfectly worth your money and does a really great job at throwing us back into the fantastic Half-Life universe. 
Lastly, I want to say that the developer commentary (inspired by the well-received audio nodes in Half-Life 2 Lost Coast) are really great to listen to. It's not every day that developers themselves take us deep into what makes their game tick, and I'm sure it's worth listening to even for players who might not be all that interested in game design anyway. 
So, if I haven't stated it clearly enough already, pick up that can... er, crowbar? And step back into City 17.
Gripping, absorbing, credible; a moody post-apocalyptic thriller in which you happen to have a trigger finger.

[h1] Half-Life 2: Episode One [/h1]

[code] Half-Life 2'nin devamı, hikayenin devamını merak ediyorsanız oynamalısınız. [/code]

[b] Oynanış [/b]
Half-Life 2'nin birebir aynısı, sadece bölüm dizaynından kaynaklı bazı silahları kullanmıyoruz bu da oynanışı kötüleştirmiş diyemem çünkü oyun çok kısa.Sıkmadan bitiyor ama şu rehine taşıma kısmında gerçekten sıkıldım.Boss Fight gibi yapılmış ama 5'e bölmüşler bu da beni sıktı şahsen.

[b] Hikaye [/b]
Hikaye kaldığı yerde devam ediyor.Zaten Half-Life serisinin hikayesi güzel bu yüzden bu oyunun hikayesi de güzel.

[b] Karakterler [/b]
3 incelemedir aynı şeyi yazıyorum artık sıkıldım, Gordon konuşmuyor birşey diyemem, bu yüzden direkt Alyx'e geçiyoruz.Half-Life 2'de sevdiğim Alyx karakteri bu oyunun tamamında bize eşlik etmekte, zaten eğlenceli bir karakter bu yüzden iyi oldu benim için.Bir de Blue Shift'ten Barney var, çok çıkmıyor karşımıza ama 2 oyundur bize levyeyi kendisi veriyor bir de espriyle veriyor.Karakterler cidden eğlenceli.

Seriye kesinlikle girin.Oynatır kendini.Half-Life 3 gelince de oynarız artık.

The worst parts of HL2 condesned down into a 4 hour game. Alyx is the worst AI compannion I've ever had in a video game. She's just as braindead as the squadmates in HL2 except this time she's glued to my back 90% of the game which really doesn't help when half of the game is set in narrow corridors. I died more time because of her blocking my way as I try to avoid grenades than I did to enemies. They nearly managed to make me hate her completely.
This is on the level of a fan made mod, it's shocking that this was actually made by Valve.

Muhteşem

Mostly everything I said in my Half-Life 2 review stands. This is a great continuation of Half-Life 2. However, it certainly feels like a small episode in terms of how the story is progressed. Although, it still goes in a very interesting direction.

One thing I love about this game, however, is the character of Alyx. I won't say she was bad in the original Half-Life 2, but she did feel a bit bland. Here, she is given so much more life and personality that it's incredibly hard to dislike her. She is great!

Don't expect a complete upgrade like how it was from Half-Life 1 to 2. This is simply more Half-Life 2 with some new ideas thrown in. Overall, a really great time.
